content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers
The structure consists of:
- 8 total building blocks
- 3 main layers (base cylindrical pillars, middle yellow platform, top cylindrical pillar with roofs)

## Spatial Relationships
- Base: Two vertical orange cylindrical pillars positioned parallel to each other
- Middle: Two yellow rectangular blocks forming a cross/T-shape platform that sits on top of the base pillars
- Upper: One tall orange cylindrical pillar rising from the left base pillar, passing through the yellow platform
- Roofs: Three orange triangular roof pieces (one on top of the tall pillar, two on the yellow platform sections)

# Required Blocks from the Dictionary

Based on my analysis, I need the following blocks:
- 3× Block #6 (vertical orange cylinder) - for the two base pillars and one tall pillar
- 2× Block #1 (horizontal yellow rectangle) - for the platform's cross shape
- 3× Block #13 (orange triangular roof) - for the three roof pieces

# Assembly Order

```
{
    Step1: Move block with index 6
    Step2: Move block with index 6
    Step3: Move block with index 1
    Step4: Move block with index 1
    Step5: Move block with index 6
    Step6: Move block with index 13
    Step7: Move block with index 13
    Step8: Move block with index 13
}
```

This assembly follows a bottom-up approach, first placing the two base pillars, then adding the horizontal yellow platform pieces, then the tall vertical pillar, and finally placing the three triangular roof pieces to complete the structure.
